author: Leslie Scism
title: MetLife Finance Chief Steps Down
text:
MetLife Inc.â€™s chief financial officer has stepped down from the position, days after the company announced reduced compensation tied to weaknesses in internal financial controls.
John C.R. Hele is being succeeded immediately but is expected to stay until September as a senior adviser. He received 6.4% less in total compensation in 2017 than the year before, including a 25% reduction in the cash portion of his incentive pay.
